terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or files over time, allowing users to access previous versions and see what modifications were made.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to documents or systems, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
A single, unified platform where all organizational documents and information are stored, organized, and accessed from one location.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed via web browsers.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization.
Product Lifecycle Management - software that manages the entire lifecycle of a product from conception through design, manufacturing, and disposal.
The systematic approach to ensuring that documentation and processes meet regulatory requirements and industry standards.
The process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining documents in a systematic way to ensure accessibility and accuracy.
Software capabilities that allow multiple users to work together on documents simultaneously, including real-time editing and sharing functions.
International Organization for Standardization guidelines that establish quality, safety, and efficiency requirements for products and processes.
Detailed written records that describe step-by-step procedures, workflows, and methodologies used in manufacturing or business operations.
The process of connecting different software systems or platforms so they can share data and work together seamlessly.
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems as soon as modifications are made to documents or data.
The adherence to laws, regulations, and industry standards that govern how businesses operate and maintain their documentation.
